title: CN Level 9 — Performance & Troubleshooting
concept: Scenario-based questions on diagnosing latency, packet loss and connectivity problems.

challenges.question: Users report that a web application is very slow. Which initial step best helps distinguish between a local network issue and a remote/server issue?

options.A: Immediately reinstall the browser on all client PCs
options.B: Ping the default gateway and then an external IP like 8.8.8.8

challenges.explanation: Pinging the gateway checks local network; pinging an external IP checks connectivity beyond the LAN.

challenges.question: Frequent disconnections in a video call app are MOST likely caused by:

options.B: Wi-Fi interference or network congestion leading to packet loss
options.C: A wrong system time on PCs

challenges.explanation: Real-time apps are sensitive to packet loss and jitter, often caused by wireless issues or congestion.

challenges.question: Only one user in the office has slow Internet while others are fine. Which check should be done FIRST?

options.A: Replace all switches in the office
options.B: Check that user’s network adapter status, cable/Wi-Fi signal and background downloads
options.C: Change the ISP for the whole office
options.D: Reconfigure the core router’s WAN IP

challenges.explanation: Since the problem is isolated to one user, start with that host’s local connection and processes.

challenges.question: Users experience brief disconnections every hour. Which of the following is MOST likely a layer 1 or 2 cause?

options.A: Incorrect DNS record for external website
options.B: Loose Ethernet cable or failing switch port
options.C: Invalid SSL certificate on the server
options.D: Wrong subnet mask on the WAN link

challenges.explanation: Physical or data-link issues like loose cables and bad ports can cause intermittent link drops.

challenges.question: Why is having a performance baseline for the network useful?

options.A: It eliminates the need for monitoring tools
options.B: It allows you to compare current metrics with normal values to detect anomalies
options.C: It guarantees that no future problems will occur
options.D: It is only required for wireless networks

challenges.explanation: A baseline helps identify abnormal latency, throughput, or loss by comparison with known-good conditions.
